item.title: Strengthening Cybersecurity with Privileged Account Management (PAM)
item.description:
In today’s increasingly complex digital landscape, managing privileged accounts is more critical than ever. With cyber threats becoming more sophisticated and targeted, organizations must focus on securing the most sensitive access pointsâ€”privileged accounts. A robust Privileged Account Management (PAM) strategy helps mitigate risks by controlling and monitoring access to critical systems and data.

What is Privileged Account Management?

Privileged accounts are user accounts that have elevated access to critical systems and sensitive data. These include accounts like system administrators, root users, database administrators, and other users who can make system-wide changes or access confidential information.
